intro: Brachystelma canum, commonly known as the Cape sugarbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant is shrub-like, with woody stems and small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is adapted to arid environments and produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds. Brachystelma canum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is a common component of fynbos vegetation.
